title: Tommy McCulloch (footballer, born 1934)
text:
Thomas McCulloch (1 March 1934 – 10 December 2016) was a Scottish <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a>.
McCulloch joined <a href="Clyde%20F.C.">Clyde</a> from local <a href="Scottish%20Junior%20Football%20Association">junior</a> side <a href="Bridgeton%20Waverley%20F.C.">Bridgeton Waverley</a> in 1957. He won the <a href="Scottish%20Cup">Scottish Cup</a> in <a href="1958%20Scottish%20Cup%20Final">1958</a>, his first season with the club and in senior football, keeping a clean sheet in the final against <a href="Hibernian%20F.C.">Hibernian</a>. McCulloch was one of Clyde's greatest servants, and spent 15 years with the club, making 475 appearances in all competitions. He left Clyde in 1972 and joined <a href="Hamilton%20Academical%20F.C.">Hamilton Academical</a> for a year before retiring.
He played a total of 491 games in his 16-year career. He regularly attended Clyde functions, and was presented with a bottle of whisky in the 2007–08 Clyde player of the year event, to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the 1958 Scottish Cup win. He was inducted into the inaugural <a href="Clyde%20F.C.%23Hall%20of%20Fame">Clyde FC Hall of Fame</a> in 2011. His death was announced on 10 December 2016.
Honours.
Clyde
